intro: Wendlandia nitens, commonly known as the silverleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist climates, often in forested or rocky habitats. Its foliage is covered in a fine, silvery down, which gives it its common name. The flowers, which range in color from white to pale blue, bloom in late spring to early summer.
